page.title: 14RECREATION ON SCAMMONDEN DAM
page.content: In the past Water Authority land has been kept strictly private,but with increasing leisure there has been a change in attitudes.Now dinghies sail across Scammonden Dam and people walk or picnic on the banks. The Sailing Club was formed in 1971 and now has around 120 members.It costs Â£30 a year to use the facilities while day membership tickets cost Â£5. Although the weekend is inevitably the most popular sailing time,Wednesday and Thursday evenings see a good turn- out.The club headquarters are in the old Deanhead Vicarage where a bar is included in the facilities.For the more adventurous, there is now a wind- surfing section. The conversion of an old farm building into a Youth Activity Centre is going ahead and when completed it will accommodate 36 young people.
